TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PrintDialog extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Invokes a standard Microsoft Windows print dialog box that configures a and according to user input and then prints a document.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A user can use the **Print** dialog box to select a printer, configure it, and perform a print job.
Strictly speaking, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog.PrintDocument%2A> method without ever opening the dialog. In that sense, the control can be used as an unseen printing component. But for performance reasons, it would be better to use either the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.AddJob%2A> method or one of the many <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>. For more about this, see [How to: Programmatically Print XPS Files](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/how-to-programmatically-print-xps-files.md).
Do not confuse this class, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog?displayProperty=fullName>, with <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog?displayProperty=fullName>. The latter is used with Windows Forms applications. <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog?displayProperty=fullName> is used with [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wpf](~/includes/tlasharptla-wpf-md.md)] applications.
## Examples The following example shows how to create an instance of and display a simple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog> by using [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] markup and code.
[!code-xml[PrintDialog#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PrintDialog/CSharp/Window1.xaml#2)]
...
[!code-csharp[PrintDialog#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PrintDialog/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#1)] [!code-vb[PrintDialog#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/PrintDialog/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the option to print the current page is enabled.
Docs.value: if the option to print the current page is enabled; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the highest page number that is allowed in page ranges.
Docs.value: A that represents the highest page number that can be used in a page range in the **Print** dialog box.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Users who click **Print** when the **Print** dialog box is set to print pages outside the range that is set by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog.MaxPage%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog.MinPage%2A> values will get an error message advising them of the maximum and minimum page numbers. Nothing will be printed.

Docs.exception: The property is being set to less than 1.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the lowest page number that is allowed in page ranges.
Docs.value: A that represents the lowest page number that can be used in a page range in the **Print** dialog box.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Users who click **Print** when the **Print** dialog box is set to print pages outside the range that is set by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog.MaxPage%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog.MinPage%2A> values will get an error message advising them of the maximum and minimum page numbers. Nothing will be printed.

Docs.exception: The property is being set to less than 1.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the range of pages to print when is set to .
Docs.value: A that represents the range of pages that are printed.
Docs.exception: The object that is being used to set the property has either the beginning of the range or the end of the range set to a value that is less than 1.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the for this instance of .
Docs.value: The value that represents the type of page range to print.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the that is used by the when the user clicks **Print** for the current print job.
Docs.value:
A that is used the next time the **Print** button in the dialog box is clicked.
Setting this property does not validate or modify the specified for a particular . If needed, use the method to create a -specific that is valid for a given printer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Neither setting nor getting this property validates the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket>. To validate it use <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A>.
